In Julia, Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

Here's how you can define the function in Julia:

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt, bump=3)
    if typeof(dt) != DateTime
        throw(ArgumentError("Only DateTime types are accepted."))
    end
    return dt + Hour(bump)
end
```
This function will increase the given timestamp by a specified number of hours. If no number is provided, it will default to increasing the time by 3 hours. It checks if the input type is DateTime and throws an error for any other types (such as Date).
